38 static gboolean get_interface_info(const char* iface, struct ifreq* ifr, int param){
39  int fd;
40  fd = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
41  /* IPv4 */
42  ifr->ifr_addr.sa_family = AF_INET;
43 
44  memset(ifr, 0, sizeof(*ifr));
45  /* Specify network interface */
46  strncpy(ifr->ifr_name, iface, IFNAMSIZ-1);
47 
48  /* ioctl - retrieve parameter from interface*/
49  if( ioctl(fd, param, ifr) < 0) {
50  g_critical("ERROR: get_ip(): ioctl failed with error message \"%s\"", strerror(errno));
51  return FALSE;
52  }
53  return TRUE;
54 }
55 #if 0
56 
62 static gboolean list_interfaces(char*** if_names, int* if_num){
63  /* Get all interfaces */
64  struct ifaddrs *ifap;
65  struct ifaddrs *iterator;
66  char **names;
67  int i = 0; /* array accessor variable */
68 
69  /* set the number of interfaces found to 0 */
70  *if_num = 0;
71  if( getifaddrs(&ifap) < 0){
72  g_critical("ERROR: Failed to get system's network interfaces");
73  return FALSE;
74  }
75  /* listing interfaces */
76  g_print("Listing network interfaces using IPv4...");
77  names = (char**) malloc(sizeof(char*));
78  /* iterate through interfaces */
79  for (iterator = ifap; iterator; iterator = iterator->ifa_next) {
80  /* get only IPv4 interface */
81  if (iterator->ifa_addr->sa_family==AF_INET)
82  {
83  names = (char**) realloc(names, (i+1) * sizeof(char*));
84  names[i] = (char*) malloc( (strlen( iterator->ifa_name ) +1) * sizeof(char));
85  strcpy(names[i], iterator->ifa_name);
86  i++;
87  }
88  }
89  *if_num = i;
90  if(if_num != 0){
91  *if_names = names;
92  return TRUE;
93  }
94  else{
95  g_critical("No compatible network interfaces have been found.");
96  return FALSE;
97  }
98 }
99 
104 gboolean select_interfaces(char*** if_used){
105  char** if_names = NULL; /* the buffer in which interface names will be stored*/
106  int if_num = 2;
107  int i= 0; /* loop variable */
108  char choice[100];
109  int length;
110  gboolean valid = FALSE;
111  list_interfaces(&if_names, &if_num);
112 
113  /* Ask to the user which network interfaces he wants VIVOE to use */
114  g_print("Which network interface you want VIVOE to use?");
115  for(i = 0; i < if_num; i++){
116  g_print("[%d]\t%s", i+1, if_names[i]);
117  }
118  g_print("Your choice [default: all]:");
119  length = scanf("%s", choice);
120  if(length == 0){
121  g_critical("Not a valid choice");
122  return FALSE;
123  }
124  if( ! strcmp(choice, "all")){
125  g_print("You choose: %s", if_names[i]);
126  }else{
127  for(i =0; i<if_num; i++){
128  if( strtol(choice, NULL, 10) == (i+1) ){
129  g_print("You choose: %s", if_names[i]);
130  valid = TRUE;
131  }
132  }
133  }
134  if( !valid){
135  g_critical("Invalid input ");
136  return FALSE;
137  }else
138  return TRUE;
139 }
140 #endif
141 /* define the number of ioctl calls to make */
142 #define calls_num 5
143 
148 struct ethernetIfTableEntry *init_ethernet(const char* iface){
149 
150  /* the structure to use for retrieving information */
151  struct ifreq ifr;
152  long ethernetIfIndex = 0;
153  long ethernetIfSpeed = 0;
154  u_char ethernetIfMacAddress[MAC_ADDRESS_SIZE];
155  size_t ethernetIfMacAddress_len = MAC_ADDRESS_SIZE;
156  in_addr_t ethernetIfIpAddress = 0;
157  in_addr_t ethernetIfSubnetMask = 0;
158  in_addr_t ethernetIfIpAddressConflict = 0;
159  /* A array with the different call to ioctl to make */
160  int ioctl_call[calls_num] = {SIOCGIFINDEX,SIOCGIFMTU, SIOCGIFHWADDR, SIOCGIFADDR, SIOCGIFNETMASK };
161  int i; /* loop variable */
162  /* Get interface IP Address */
163  for(i = 0; i<calls_num; i++){
164  if( get_interface_info(iface, &ifr, ioctl_call[i])){
165  switch(ioctl_call[i]){
166  case SIOCGIFINDEX:
167  ethernetIfIndex = (ifr.ifr_ifindex);
168  break;
169  case SIOCGIFMTU:
170  ethernetIfSpeed = (ifr.ifr_mtu);
171  break;
172  case SIOCGIFHWADDR:
173  memcpy(ethernetIfMacAddress , (unsigned char*) ifr.ifr_hwaddr.sa_data, ethernetIfMacAddress_len);
174  break;
175  case SIOCGIFADDR:
176  ethernetIfIpAddress = ((struct sockaddr_in *)&ifr.ifr_addr)->sin_addr.s_addr;
177  break;
178  case SIOCGIFNETMASK:
179  ethernetIfSubnetMask = ((struct sockaddr_in *)&ifr.ifr_netmask)->sin_addr.s_addr;
180  break;
181  default:
182  /* this is a really bad error, we should never get there */
183  g_critical("unknown ioctl call");
184  return NULL;
185  }
186  }else{
187  g_critical("Failed to retrieve parameters of %s", iface);
188  return NULL;
189  }
190  }
191  /* now we can create an entry in the ethernetIfTable */
192  /* create an null Ip conflict */
193  ethernetIfIpAddressConflict = inet_netof(inet_makeaddr (0 , inet_addr("0.0.0.0")));
194  return ethernetIfTableEntry_create( ethernetIfIndex,
195  ethernetIfSpeed,
196  ethernetIfMacAddress,
197  ethernetIfMacAddress_len,
198  ethernetIfIpAddress,
199  ethernetIfSubnetMask,
200  ethernetIfIpAddressConflict);
201 
202 }
